abstract: Six countries have joined Germany in a move that may force the company to disclose what data its employees collected from unsecured wireless networks.
snippet: Six countries have joined Germany in a move that may force the company to disclose what data its employees collected from unsecured wireless networks.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — In a sign that Europe is taking an increasingly unified line on Internet privacy, six European countries have joined Germany in asking Google to preserve data it improperly collected from unsecured wireless networks as part of Street View, its photo-mapping service, the company said Friday.

headline.main: Wider European Scrutiny of Google on Privacy
headline.print_headline: Wider European Scrutiny of Google on Privacy
